name: Hotel Arnolfo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in the old town of Colle di Val d’Elsa. It is classed as a three star but I couldn’t see what this was for. It was ok to stay in, but the rooms were vacuous with few comforts and an uncared for feel – they were functional. There was a TV and minibar. The shower in the bathroom wasn’t very clean with grime around its base. Breakfast was nothing to shout about, although it was served in the vaults of the building. Our bikes were stored in the garage and so were secure.
reviews.title: Functional Hotel in the Old Town

likes.disliked: — Lack of character and identity, grimey shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's not really much else to say about this place.
reviews.title: Not particularly impressed

likes.disliked: — Grubbiness of the bathroom, room was basic and cold.

reviews.text: There weren’t many places open to eat in the evening in the old town and so we had to venture down to the new town. Thankfully there is a lift that takes you down the very steep hill, which is welcomed at the end of the evening when you want to get back to your hotel.
reviews.title: well run local hotel in the old village

likes.disliked: — No AC, because it was hot, when we visited Tuscany.

reviews.title: Great little town and good hotel
reviews.text: The outside of this hotel gives the impression of it being better than what it actually is. The typical Tuscan colour of the exterior with its 3 stars being shown proudly on the board outside lead you to believe this may be of a pretty good standard. The staff were efficient with showing us where we could store our bikes in the garage at the rear leaving us to take the lift to our room.

Hotel looks quite good from the outside - 3 stars and all that - cheap too, but when you get to the room, oh my... I would echo the last few reviews, the room is basic and in massive need of refurb. The bathroom was tired and the grime around the shower was deep enough to grow spuds in it. The state of the place may be due to the cleaning lady, who looked about 90. Breakfast was included in the rate, but this might be the worst breakfast in Italy. Soggy croissants, juie from a push button machine, cheese slices you could put in a window frame, and the coffee was undrinkable. Did you think it was impossible to have a bad coffee in Italy? Try here!
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the hotel is in the centre, noise from the kids outside kept us all up until 3am - no air con means you need to open the windows.
reviews.title: Disappointing
